Package org.jemmy.fx

This package contains classes which allow to test Java FX UI for Java FX 2.0 and above.
Top-level API of Jemmy FX is exposed through *Dock classes.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    NodeParent
    An SPI interface for a parent for nodes.
    WindowElement<WINDOW>
    The interface specifies how to get a "window" in which control resides.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractNodeHierarchy
    This is an SPI class encapsulating functionality needed to implement Hierarchy of nodes.
    AppExecutor
    An utility class to runs an FX application.
    ByID<T>
    A criterion to find a control by its ID.
    ByObject<ITEM>
    A criterion to find an object by id.
    ByStyleClass<T extends javafx.scene.Node>
    A criterion to find a node by CSS style name.
    ByText<T>
    A criterion to find nodes by text.
    ByTitleSceneLookup<T extends javafx.scene.Scene>
    A criterion to find scenes by title.
    ByWindowType<T extends javafx.scene.Scene>
    A criterion to fins scenes by window class.
    CriteriaList<T> Deprecated
    Not really needed
    FXClickFocus
    This is an SPI class for giving focus to FX controls by clicking on them.
    FXRelativeCoordinateLookup<CONTROL extends javafx.scene.Node>
    In the worst case scenario, you could look for a node which is to the left/right or higher/lower than another node.
    Lookups Deprecated
    Use Docks.
    NodeHierarchy  
    NodeParentImpl  
    NodeWrap<T extends javafx.scene.Node>
    Test support for JavaFX node.
    NodeWrapper
    Wraps javafx.scene.Node into an appropriate Wrap.
    QueueExecutor
    A utility class to work with Java FX event queue.
    Root
    Root class for Java FX scene lookup.
    SceneWrap<T extends javafx.scene.Scene>
    Support for Java FX scene.
    TextWrap<T extends javafx.scene.text.Text>
    A wrap around javafx.scene.text.Text.
    Utils  
    Version  
    WindowWrap<T extends javafx.stage.Window>
    Window could be used as a target for mouse events.

Package org.jemmy.fx Description

This package contains classes which allow to test Java FX UI for Java FX 2.0 and above.
Top-level API of Jemmy FX is exposed through *Dock classes. Docks exist for scenes (SceneDock), nodes and its subclasses(NodeDock, TextInputControlDock) and items of compound controls such as list, table, and such (ListItemDock, TreeItemDock, TableCellItemDock).
Please consult samples for examples of real test code.
